message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.LG

This paper deals with the classification of discourse acts in social media conversations using a novel attention-based hierarchical LSTM model. The paper primarily focuses on natural language processing and machine learning techniques to analyze social media data, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of non-textual features like location and time, which can be categorized under social and information sciences (cs.SI) and systems and control (cs.SD). The paper also presents an analysis of different embedding schemes and architectures, which can be categorized under cybernetics (cs.CY) and machine learning (cs.LG). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL, followed by cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, and cs.LG.
